snippet: A growing number of primary care doctors and specialists in private practice are becoming employees of hospitals, though experts caution that the change may not yield better or cheaper care for patients.
abstract: Growing number of primary care doctors and specialists in private practice, worried about changes in health care market, are becoming salaried employees of hospitals; experts caution that change may not yield better or cheaper care for patients.
lead_paragraph: A growing number of primary care doctors and specialists in private practice are becoming employees of hospitals, though experts caution that the change may not yield better or cheaper care for patients.

headline.main: Apprehensive, Many Doctors Shift to Jobs With Salaries
headline.print_headline: Apprehensive, Many Doctors Shift to Jobs With Salaries
